hints.content:
$\purpleD{206} = {\greenD{?}}-\goldE{519}$

![A number line with 2 points labeled. An arrow from point question mark back to point 206 is labeled, minus 519.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e61f92b8faf1684f8967c0d99a7b81e385f97744)

What number can we subtract $\goldE{519}$ from and be left with $\purpleD{206}?$

We can add $\goldE{519}$ to $\purpleD{206}$ to find the missing number.

$\begin{align}\goldE{519}&\\
\underline{+ \purpleD{206}} &\\
\greenD{725}&\end{align}$

![The same number line as above, with the question mark replaced with 725 and an arrow from 206 to 725 labeled plus 519](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6becc57b2ff88712cd317d2dd38d17231877485c)

question.content:
**What number makes this equation true?**

$206 = {}$ [[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] ${} - 519$
